OVERVIEW: The Irim series consists of very deep, poorly drained soils on nearly level to slightly concave or depressed areas of flood plains and low terraces.  These soils formed in alluvial sediments derived from a variety of sources.  Slopes are 0 to 6 percent.  Mean annual precipitation is about 15 inches, and the mean annual temperature is about 40 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive, frigid Typic Endoaquolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Irim loam, grassland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
0i--1 to 0 inches; undecomposed organic material, mostly grass and roots.
Ag--0 to 11 inches; dark gray (10YR 4/1) loam, black (10YR 2/1) moist; common medium distinct yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) redox concentrations; weak medium subangular blocky structure; very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 10 percent pebbles; neutral (pH 7.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (6 to 23 inches thick)
Bwg--11 to 60 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) very gravelly loam, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; common medium prominent light olive brown (2.5Y 5/6) and dark gray (2.5Y 4/1) redox concentrations; weak medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 50 percent pebbles; mildly alkaline (pH 7.4)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Gunnison County, Colorado; 1 mile south of Doyleville, along Tomichi Creek; in SW 1/4, Sec. 34 T. 49 N., R. 3 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Mean annual soil temperature is 42 degrees F., and mean summer soil temperature is 60 degrees F.  The Irim soils typically are noncalcareous to depths of more than 60 inches, but depth to uniformly calcareous material ranges from 40 to more than 60 inches.  Thin organic horizons typically occur on the surface of these soils but are absent in some pedons.  The 10- to 40_ inch control section is typically loam, clay loam, or sandy clay loam and has 18 to 34 percent clay, 15 to 50 percent silt, and 20 to 60 percent sand.  Rock fragments range from 35 to 80 percent ina a major part of the control section and are mainly less than 3 inches in diameter but range from1/8 to 10 inches in deameter.  The solum is neutral or mildly alkaline.
The A horizon has hue of 5YR through 7.5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of neutral through 2.  Distinct or prominent redoximorphic features occurs in at least some part of the A horizon.
The Bw horizon has hue of 5Y through 7.5YR, value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of neutral through 2.  Distinct or prominent redox features, at least part of which has low chroma, occurs in this horizon.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  This is the (T) Poronto (MT) series.  This series needs further study.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Irim soils are on nearly level to slightly concave or depressed areas of flood plains and low terraces.  Slope gradients usually range from 0 to about 6 percent. The soil formed in alluvial sediments derived from a variety of sources.  At the type location the mean annual precipitation is 15 inches with peak periods occurring during the spring and summer.  The mean annual temperature is 40 degrees F., mean summer temperature is 62 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Gas Creek and Gold Creek soils.  Gas Creek soils are coarse textured.  Gold Creek soils are fine textured and are calcareous throughout.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Poorly drained; slow runoff or ponded; moderate permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used as native pastureland and for native hay crops.  Native vegetation is mainly timothy, redtop, fescues, alsike clover, sedges, and rushes.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Mountain areas of central and western Colorado. The series is of small extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

REMARKS.content: REMARKS:  Diagnostic features include a mollic epipedon from 0 to 11 inches and aquic conditions above 80 inches.  Last updated by the state 12/93.

HORIZONS.name: 0i
HORIZONS.narrative: 0i--1 to 0 inches; undecomposed organic material, mostly grass and roots.

HORIZONS.name: Ag
HORIZONS.narrative: Ag--0 to 11 inches; dark gray (10YR 4/1) loam, black (10YR 2/1) moist; common medium distinct yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) redox concentrations; weak medium subangular blocky structure; very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 10 percent pebbles; neutral (pH 7.0); gradual wavy boundary.  (6 to 23 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: Bwg
HORIZONS.narrative: Bwg--11 to 60 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) very gravelly loam, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; common medium prominent light olive brown (2.5Y 5/6) and dark gray (2.5Y 4/1) redox concentrations; weak medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 50 percent pebbles; mildly alkaline (pH 7.4)
